segments.text: Is your city a historical place ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Not rally . 200 years ago , it was just a small insignificant village .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: How did it grow into such a large place ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Large deposits of coal were found nearly and so many industries located themselves here . The village quickly grew into a key industrial centre .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: As the city grew , it must have absorbed many village nearby .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , it did . The names of those village survive as the names of parts of the city .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . Are there any building more than 200 years old in your city ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , yes . Several of the buildings from the villages still survive . Many of them were inns for travelers and today survive as pubs . There was a castle near one village , so our city has a castle too .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Really ? So your city does have some old history after all .
segments.speaker: S1
